Video quality isn't that great, especially given that the file is almost 900MB & video is encoded at 989KBps.  

Also, the person who encoded this did not crop the black bars from the top/bottom.  Get this only if you're desperate to watch this movie.  

Note that I haven't watched this copy yet so can't comment any further.

Oh yeah, & the video is actually encoded at 640x480.

So while the movie itself, taking into account the letterbox, is the correct AR - you may find that some players will automatically stretch the image, so you'll have to play around with settings - no big deal really, but just mentioning it.

Any of these things can be fixed if you use AVISynth.

There was one other thing I forgot to mention. The rip hasn't been deinterlaced either. There are several scenes I noticed while flicking through, but one example is around the 1m40s action sequence, interlace lines are clearly noticeable. I tried to deinterlace using AVISynth but the results were ugly at best.
